website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you want an attractive small feeder that you can put almost anywhere at a great price.
pros: A solid little feeder that's  versatile for numerous locations, thanks to its lightweight build and Sure-Lock lid that deters squirrels
Has a 360º perch and holds up to 2 lbs
cons: Has the tendency to spill seeds, which occurs more readily when large birds try to feed from it
The finish may fade after extended exposure to the elements

customer_reviews.title: Brings all the birds to the yard
customer_reviews.text: Within 3 days of setting this up, I had every bird in the neighborhood eating right outside my kitchen window. It's simple, durable, easy to fill and clean, and hold a good amount of seed. The only downside is that it isn't squirrel-proof at all. I almost got a pic of a squirrel doing gymnastics on it. I ended up spraying the rail/perch with canola oil and now the squirrels fall off; so I guess the small problem has been solved.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Finches happy with the cafeteria
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far, finches love it and the design is such that the morning doves are unable to get to the perch and camp out. I used to use a bowl type feeder, but the morning doves would just live in that thing, now they do the cleanup on the bottom and the finches are able to enjoy the feeder. The unit I ordered was all busted up at the base, but Amazon made exchanging it the easiest experience I've ever gone through; second unit in perfect working order. You do need a hook or something to hang it from, I used a custom bent piece of coat hanger.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: All plastic but well constructed and the birds like it while the squirrels are frustrated with it. The lightweight makes it easy to hang. Nice addition to the deck railing and more birds mean less bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love the bird feeder but it doesn't keep the squirrels out unless they have the ingenuity . But, the birds do love it..the doves are now taking a look at it trying to find a way to balance.
customer_reviews.author: crazyartdolls

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled with the quality of the metal.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice feeder, and the feathered friends in our yard seem to enjoy it. The problem is with the finish. What was once a very pretty bronze finish quickly became extremely weathered (from very little bad weather, I might add), dull, bare metal finish. It's no longer smooth and difficult to clean, as the rough texture "grabs" bird poop and won't let go. Stains VERY easily, so any poop that hits it will leave a stain. This has resulted in a very splotchy, dull, ugly finish. I'm just waiting for the roof to begin to corrode.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall B.Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Well-constructed and priced right - a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who will feed everything and everyone, i think this feeder is great. It's not squirrel-proof (they haven't figured out how to open it from the top yet, but they can eat from it easily enough), but I like feeding them too, so it's all good. Big birds (cardinals, female blue jays, turtle doves) and little birds alike can perch easily. The clear container bit is a good thicker plastic and has not broken despite hitting the ground a few times after getting knocked off the hanger by wind. Overall, birds, squirrels and humans are happy with this feeder in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: Great squirrel feeder. Brought them by the dozen.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, Charlie: this one is most definitely NOT squirrel proof. All they need to do is keep rocking and tapping, and the feeder will send oodles out the bottom onto the ground. Perhaps my West Florida squirrels are Einstein-esque, but they cracked the code on this immediately. It literally attracted the whole neighborhood, who terrorized this thing for days until I declared 'no mas.' Nary a bird in sight, ever. On to the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Stuart

customer_reviews.title: All for the birds
customer_reviews.text: We've had this bird feeder for about 4 months already and it is still holding up really well. We definitely get a variety of different wild birds visiting. It is easy to fill which I like, unfortunately because of the open design at the bottom when we're filling it, some of the smaller bird seeds spill everywhere. Love it for my the smaller birds that come, but the doves like visiting as well and when they visit it swings a lot and they tend to be messy eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful, broke in 1 day
customer_reviews.text: How this product has any many good ratings is baffling to me. We I opened the box for the product I was immediately disappointed. It was just built cheap with plastic and thin metal wire. I decided to give it a try and be optimistic, so I hung it in my yard. The next day this item was on the ground broken into pieces. 1 day. My husband told me that a squirrel had gotten on it and it instantly broke apart (not just fell). Then as it broke it fell. And broke some more when I hit the ground. And this product is touted as being “squirrel proof.” What a joke! Save your $$ on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ycash

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is easy to fill plus it is a sturdy feeder. I will eventually order another one. The birds seem to choose favorite feeders and this one seems to be the most used. I have about 5 to 6 feeders in my garden and quickly discover the frustrations of having to refill them. This one is easy. I recommend this feeder. The cardinals, blue jays, woodpeckers, yellow finches, wrens and mockingbirds like it too!
customer_reviews.author: HappySoul

customer_reviews.title: Not Squirrel Proof But All Our Birds Love These
customer_reviews.text: I love the looks of these and they hold a nice amount of seed. We use Black Sunflower Seeds only since the birds seem to prefer this. We have all kinds of bird including Cardinals, Goldfinch, Titmouse, Nuthatch, Chickadees and early spring even Eastern Bluebirds! All are able to perch and feed easily and stay around.....except when our little squirrels decide to cling to the top and stretch and tip the feeders to empty them! Have tried WD 40, Cooking Spray to prevent them but they eventually manage to get in.
customer_reviews.author: CAG - NC

customer_reviews.title: The very best bird feeder I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to fill, unlike all of the others I've bought. You can slide the lid up - you push in this little whatever, and you slide it up and it STAYS until you're done and then you push it again and slide the lid down and turn it a little and it locks into place. All of this info might have been in the description which I didn't read. I liked the way it looked and still do very much and got all of these wonderful things with it to make it enjoyable to feed these hungry little things. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jani

customer_reviews.title: DOVES LOVE IT🤬
customer_reviews.text: I was so hoping that this feeder would not be dove friendly. I bought it to feed cardinals. Filled it with cardinal food (sunflower and safflower seeds), the cardinals did come to the feeder, but the doves monopolized it and had it wiped out in less than 24 hours. **After a week, we used wire to build a ‘cage’ around the feeder. The doves are having a more difficult time (but don’t give up), and the cardinals are still able to use it. Still in search of a feeder that doves aren’t able to use.
customer_reviews.author: island gardener

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, well-made, attractive
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Well made, the second one I bought. Only one tiny issue, the cord is not as still as the first one, and bends over easily rather than staying upright. This makes it a little harder to hang up, and a stretch, because it keeps flopping over. Very good quality. I enjoy having a round feeder, rather than square, the birds sometimes circle when feeding. Fun to watch. Plus, I like that it's not too big, I prefer to refill often because of squirrels and this works well.
customer_reviews.author: Abby McIlroy

customer_reviews.title: The Perky-Pet 312 Panorama Bird Feeder is an Excellent Design and Construction with Value
customer_reviews.text: The Perky-Pet 312 Panorama Bird Feeder has been superbly designed with excellent material and construction. Over the years we have trialed several other bird feeders. So far, the Panorama Bird Feeder is the best we have owned. For example, the round, clear plastic bird storage seed bin that we easily clean the inside, and outside. The seed tray has a smaller diameter than the roof top. And, the larger overhead of the roof top usually keeps the seed dry in the tray when it rains. Finally, the perch surrounding the circular tray enables several birds to feed at the same time. The Panorama Bird Feeder is our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Kayak1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value...no problems
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Perky Pet bird feeder of this model, but I am not replacing them but rather adding to my bird feeding station! My first one I received as a gift 2 years ago and it still looks great...some weathering but it's an outdoor wild bird feeder. I have since purchased 2 more just so I can feed more birds! Seed flows nicely. Pretty easy to clean. I have had no problems with rain getting into the feeders and getting the seed wet (but my feeders are partially under a tree). Birds love them. I wouldn't pay more for another feeder...these look great, work great, and are an amazing value. Thanks for making these!
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten SH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Researched many different feeders (all crazy expensive) and then came across this one and I'm glad I did! It's very sturdy. I hung it from a heavy duty Shepard's hook that has a strong metal base. Didn't see a squirrel try to get into it at all (and we have quite a few around). I did spray the hook with cooking spray to help keep the squirrels off. Closes well. Birds love it!
customer_reviews.author: stormy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Came already broken it was still usable but the squirrels knocked it off the pole and it broke even more. I have another one of these but it’s the older version and it it was better. I wish this was like the other one which the squirrels have knocked down many times without breaking it. Completely disappointed in this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Shephard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy to use Bird Feed - arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Really like this bird feeder. It's easy to fill and clean, and provides enough perch for many birds. It came delivered in a very sturdy box with inserts to hold it in place. I was very surprised that one of the tabs on the cylinder was broken off. The tabs seems to be used for centering of the cylinder under the cap. However, since the loss of one tab doesn't affect the centering, I decided to keep it...I still like it. It was just surprising that there was any damage given the sturdiness of the box (possibly handling damage when packaged?).
customer_reviews.author: LZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bird feeder for us
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bird feeder that would hold a decent amount of bird seed without being too large or too long as where we had space to hang it a longer bird feeder would have been too close to the ground. This one is easy to fill, seems sturdy and the cord to hang it from seems sturdy as well. I think it's nice to look at too. I haven't tried to clean it yet, but can tell that when the time comes it will be easy to do. It's been in use for about 3 months now without any problems. The birds don't seem to have any complaints either.
customer_reviews.author: actuallythedog

customer_reviews.title: Not Suitable for NY Winters
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bird feeder. It was great through the fall and I am sure it will be good again in the spring. It is simply not suitable for NY winters. The top locks to prevent squirrels or chipmunks from pilfering the seed. But in the coldness of the winter months it freezes and makes it impossible to refill.
customer_reviews.author: M. Priola

customer_reviews.title: THE BIRDS LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: The old feeder we had became a hazard! We found a beautiful little finch with its neck caught between the bars and the food. With a miracle we managed to free it and let it go! To say the least, the old feeder was discarded--we won't miss it! This feeder is perfect. There is no place a bird can become entangled; there is room for plenty of seed, and it is easy for them to perch while feeding, and it is easy to clean. We have a lot of birds on our property and this feeder is just what we needed. I plan to buy another one. I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise H.

customer_reviews.title: Well made arrived quicker than estimated.
customer_reviews.text: I compared this to other feeders after I got it, have a few. I was looking for a broader brim to shed rain, easy to fill, feeding rim filled to drain water, and moderately priced, meets all of those. Came in a box with bubble wrap around the bird feeder , clean, in good shape. I saw no real difference in quality of construction compared to other feeders I owned or have looked at. In fact I saw this same feeder at Walmart for $5.00 dollars more. I was looking for smaller one to compliment my larger one . Good product .
customer_reviews.author: crichcreek

customer_reviews.title: 3 years old now and still perfect
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 1 time. You last purchased this item on January 2, 2017. I bought this over 3 years ago and it stays in the yard all year around. The Florida heat or salt air has not killed it. The birds love it. It is easy to fill and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Carsonbink

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not squirrel proof.
customer_reviews.text: Squirrel proof? No! No wonder I needed to fill the feeder every other day!
customer_reviews.author: B&T

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it, squirrels can't get at it....but deer can.  Mount it up high!
customer_reviews.text: Attracts and feeds all sorts of birds, and can support several on it at a time (we have seen 5 on it at once). If you live in an area where deer are about, I HIGHLY recommend placing it above their reach - at least 8 feet above the ground. We would wake each morning to an empty feeder, so we placed a camera outside to see who the culprit was - and it was white tailed deer. We then installed it in a tree with a nylon rope / pulley system so it can be easily raised and lowered to refill.
customer_reviews.author: Salveesalad

customer_reviews.title: Birds seem to love it.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for an inexpensive bird feeder for our front yard. This bird feeder does the trick. Within a few hours (and after throwing some bird seed on the ground) a few finches and a robin discovered the feeder. It holds a good amount of seed, and it looks like we will only have to refill it every other week. It does not come with a hook but there is a loop on the hanging wire and we just looped it around the tree and hooked the loop to the cord. It could hang lower if you used a hook and didn't loop the cord around the branch.
customer_reviews.author: elise

customer_reviews.title: the feeder is useless. The birds and I are out 3 feeders
customer_reviews.text: I bought this size & 2 larger. Each has the same problem, there is no way to secure the top, leading to the feeder off kilter pouring seed on the ground. Because it is so unsteady the birds won't use it. Very poorly made and balanced. I have tried different ways to secure the top without success, the feeder is useless. The birds and I are out 3 feeders. Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful feeder, but it's not plastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful feeder. It's very well made and the sure-lock top oughta be pretty helpful in keeping out other varmints. Unfortunately, I had to return it, as it's too heavy for my window hook. The Material Type is described as plastic, so I bought it thinking it would be light weight enough for my window hook. It's actually metal construction (very nice, heavy duty construction), and weighs over six pounds while empty, so my window hook won't hold it. If you simply need a nice quality hanging feeder, I would highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price, but won't last.
customer_reviews.text: I like to the look of the bird feeder. The birds seems to like it too. Does not keep the squirrels out though. If they can get to the bird feeder they will curl around the base and help themselves to the feed. Other issue is that after two years of continuous use two of the plastic feed at the base of the column have broken off. Making the feeder useless. But the feeder only costs $14 dollar. Would be nice though if the feet were sturdier, for instance made of metal or less brittle plastic.
customer_reviews.author: douwe

customer_reviews.title: The birds favorite feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is used more frequent than the other two I have in our yard. It’s easy to fill and clean. The seed holder is glass. It also has an extended perch all around. It seems like with the saucer style perches, even the smaller birds nearly sit in the seeds. I’ll be buying another one of these, for sure! This feeder is beautiful. Easy to open and fill. Comes with a nice flexible, attached hanger. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Birds Like It But Seed Does Not Dispense
customer_reviews.text: The product is well built and the birds like the perch. However, the bird seed does not seem to want to dispense through the feed slots. Seems like often the feed is stuck and leaves the trays with no seed available for bird even when half full. We are in the South and it appears that the inside is some times moist inside since the top fits so tight. I have to push from top with stick to get it to feed out.
customer_reviews.author: RWH

customer_reviews.title: Recommended ✅
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lil bird feeder, and the birdees love it! The feeder is sturdy, attractive, easy to fill, minimal to no spillage, as the base is wide, and the hanging cord is a sturdy looped cable for easy hanging. With it being round, allows for several simultaneous feedings. Just a couple hours after hanging, have already been visited by sparrows and lil finches. Im sure this feeder will provide years of fun bird watching, feedings and heart smiles. Would definitely recommend this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Audra D

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this feeder as my second bird feeder , love the way it looks but there's a design flaw because all your birdseed just comes out too fast . More on the ground, I fill it up and by the next day it's empty , not because of all the birds eating it , it's all under it on the ground . Very disappointed, it's very sturdy and very cute but I'm going to have to either get a different one or figure out how to slow the flow of seed in this one ! Anyone have any ideas ?
customer_reviews.author: D Bender

customer_reviews.title: Only good if under cover
customer_reviews.text: This feeder caused spoiled seeds because it allowed rain to get inside from the top/lid. The seed would clump and stay wet inside the feeder. Also, the drain holes on the outside rim were too small to be effective. And, the slots where seed comes out onto rim were too small. If you have a covered porch, this feeder might work better. Otherwise, I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: It's mostly as advertised with one minor issue
customer_reviews.text: We note a suspected design/manufacturing flaw - the barrel of the feeder has twist lock tabs on its bottom for attaching it to the base. There are also twist lock tabs at the top of the barrel, however, there are no corresponding tabs in the feeder top assembly for twist locking it firmly in place. Thankfully, the push button "sure lock" cap manages to hold the top in place making it usable.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Fred

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love watching the birds outside our front window now. This feeder has resisted all squirrels too! I think this feeder is meant for smaller birds like sparrows though because our cardinals had a hard time craning their necks a bit from where their feet hook on the rail.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This little feeder is great quality for a wonderful price. The bird seed lasts about 2 days in it, but sometimes I catch 4-5 birds sitting and feeding at a time! They really love it! It's nice and sturdy. I haven't seen any squirrels trying to get into it, and I don't think they could due to the hanging/ locking mechanism. I'm happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: WillWork4Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Decent but I don't think my birds really enjoy it as much
customer_reviews.text: Came slightly busted but otherwise is sturdy. Instructions would have been nice to have for the minor assembly. Birds ate from it starting out but seemed to not enjoy it as much or stop for some reason midway through the feed. Maybe the feed of seeds isn't quite fluid enough to continuously pour? Otherwise, I like the design and everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Jarnagin

customer_reviews.title: With all due respect to the multiple stars, this is garbage
customer_reviews.text: The plastic tabs holding the perch and lid break easily The rain guard is useless, since rain runs down the wire and into the feed, resulting in a clump of seeds that don't fall into the hopper. The birds eschew its presence, preferring any other feeder, of which we have many. Even when those are emptied, the birds won't mess with this one. I have had, and still own, Perky Pet feeders. So, no gripe against them specifically. But this is an inexcusably poor product. It's a POS.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great for blue jays
customer_reviews.text: This feeder holds a lot of food! I was picturing lots of little birds enjoying this but discovered the Blue Jays REALLY enjoyed it as it was easy for them to eat from. Hubby tried to rig up a chicken wire around it but it was a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but improved w/ a dab of silicone grease
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on a pole-mounted hook. No squirrel problems; it's above above an excellent baffle. The cable seemed too snug -- probably to prevent water leaks. A small bit of silicone grease, however, keeps water out and lets the lid slide more easily on the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Field, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: In these Covid/sheltering times...watching the small songbirds have given me/us great joy. I had a plastic feeder that was knocked down & broken by an inventive crow. This replacement is far sturdier & we have figured out how to hang it in a way that discourages the larger birds. (They have their own separate feeder.)
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder so far
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased so far in the several months I've had this feeder up, which has included cold and snowy weather. It's hanging from a shepherd's hook feeder stand, and would be very accessible to squirrels from the porch but I haven't seen any on it. They seem content to eat what the birds let fall to the ground. It's been very popular with local songbirds.
customer_reviews.author: Denae

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder for small birds
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small birds. It's a bit small for medium sized bird and I could see how it's awkward for the slightly larger birds to land on it and feed. I got cardinals in the first few weeks but then they stop landing on the feeder but only pick up seeds scattered around it. Other birds like cowbirds, grosbeaks, sometimes even woodpeckers would still land on it and feed, but most visitors I have are all kinds of sparrows, dark-eyed juncos, titmice and nuthatches. Squirrels love this feeder too... lol.
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: Great bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Great bird feeder at a great price. It’s easy to refill and the birds took to it right away. I’m happy to say that I’ve had no trouble with squirrels trying to eat the bird seed from this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Sprklindiamond

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking feeder straight out of the box, BUT........
customer_reviews.text: My birds prefer this type of dispensing feeder. I needed to replace a similar feeder and chose this one based on its looks (copper), size, and pricing. Just too flimsy for my taste. Did not hold up well and did not stay looking “nice” for any length of time. As in, “Oh, what a pretty feeder!”) Had to replace quickly. I will be glad to spend more money on a more substantial feeder.
customer_reviews.author: JMW

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel proof
customer_reviews.text: The clear part is plastic - so not easy to break. Also, the best part is I got one of those poles to attach to my 2nd floor deck railing from which this bird feeder hangs about 12' above the ground. So far the squirrels have climbed on the metal pole, but never jumped to the bird feeder as they don't see how to hang on to it, so they aren't eating the seeds meant for the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect and exactly as described. The birds started using it within about an hour of hanging it up. I have bird visitors all the time now!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not squirrel proof
customer_reviews.text: The easy release button on the top to pull the top up doesn't always work. It takes some fiddling some times for it to release. It does release black sunflowers nicely and the birds love it. The squirrels are able to wrap themselves around it to feed. It is touch though and has survived some wind storms.
customer_reviews.author: India

customer_reviews.title: Easily disassembles for cleaning which is a bird feeder's must have.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brown one to replace my Copper Perky-Pet Panorama Bird Feeder which had weathered badly. I'm hoping the darker color will not show the weathering as badly as the copper one does. This Brown Perky-Pet Panorama is identical in size to the Copper one so identifying it as "small" can cause confusion. The base, clear tubular housing and top all disassemble for easy cleaning. It holds 2 lbs of seed.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: My birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have some blue jays, cardinals and even some doves who really give this feeder a workout. It is easy to fill and holds quite a lot of food. Of course the smaller sparrows use it too! It is hidden inside a tree by our patio room so we are able to watch them feed. It is very attractive and looks nice anywhere you would want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: KYNana

customer_reviews.title: Not a great design
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the issue is but our bird food basiclly just dropped out on the ground with any small breeze. We tried several things but finally gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Revising review. This is an alright feeder.
customer_reviews.text: I'm revising my review. I didn't like how the lid doesn't lock and appears to be missing the component under the lid that would do that but there is a locking feature at the top that secures the lid. It's not ideal but it works. It looks like it was supposed to have a locking feature under the lid but wasn't included on this model- or a manufacturer mistake, but it locks onto the cable instead. I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt here. The material of the feeder is very good- metal with thick plastic. It is smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Frese

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Bird Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This bird feeder is much nicer than its price would suggest and seems durable. It holds a good amount of bird seed; the large top/cover helps keep the bird seed dry; and the ring around the bottom has been perfect for birds to perch on while eating. The cover also locks into place, which should help keep the squirrels out. So glad I bought it. It took a few weeks, but now I have several birds that regularly visit.
customer_reviews.author: EPTX88

customer_reviews.title: Fat birds
customer_reviews.text: It’s winter but I still have to refill this every two days or I get birds lined up on my fence like some Hitchcock film. It sits right in front of my kitchen window so I get a nice view of all the birds stuffing their faces. I’d like to say it brings sweet music but most times I just get to hear the birds fluttering and fighting over the feeder. They love it too I guess. The falcon in the neighborhood loves it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Birds Love it...and so do we!
customer_reviews.text: Birds Love It! The primary species in our yard are Cardinal, Titmouse and Chickadees birds. Cardinals need room because of their size. This feeder fits them and their smaller neighbors. Easy to fill using a inexpensive birdseed funnel. We ordered a second one and have regular feathered entertainment outside our window. A great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ramage

customer_reviews.title: Wax The Lid, Or You'll Be Sorry.
customer_reviews.text: I went through 2 of the copper coated lid feeders. The top became rusty on both, the plastic cracked on the one. So I bought this one with a painted top. I coated the lid with a heavy dose of automotive wax to prevent deterioratition. Just make sure you reapply the wax when it stops beading.
customer_reviews.author: George Leroy Tirebiter

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it.
customer_reviews.text: The birds love to visit this feeder and that's enough for me. I often see five or six birds at once perching on its ring. The top easily slides up the supporting cable when pressing the release button, making refilling easy to do. It holds a generous amount of seed but not so much that its weight would bend supporting structures. The only concern I have about this style of feeder is the steel cable itself, which has failed me on occasion. I believe, however, the convenience is worth it and that replacement every couple of years is acceptable given the enormous amount of pleasure this hobby provides.
customer_reviews.author: EE Moon

customer_reviews.title: cheap material
customer_reviews.text: I used to have two of these for years. Easy to clean, birds loved it. Last year I had to replace on and it did not make it through a year. The one I bought came already broken in the box. If it was made from better material I would say one of the best feeders. As it is now, junk, don't buy it. if does not come broken, it will break soon after.
customer_reviews.author: O. Lazar

customer_reviews.title: Works well in squirrel-less Hawaii
customer_reviews.text: We don't have squirrels, so this feeder works very well and is plenty durable. The feeder looks very nice and comes well packed for protection. We live in rural Hawaii, so what falls on,the ground is eaten by the wild chickens walking around. Right now we are going through about a pound of seed per day, so the birds must like it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wolford

customer_reviews.title: Roof won't stay in place so feeder tips sideways
customer_reviews.text: The roof of this feeder doesn't attach to the seed holding portion so as soon as a bird lands on the perch, the whole thing tips sideways. The top of the seed holder has flanges that don't do anything which is puzzling. There should be a way to make roof stay attached to seed holder until you need to refill. Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Sticht

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating to fill
customer_reviews.text: The pros for this product are the that it holds a large amount of seeds for small birds , and it was shipped quite quickly. That being said, filling the feeder is frustrating, the lid tilts to fill the seed but, it is extremely frustrating to get the lid to properly seat and lock onto the seed holder and if I can't get it to lock down, the lid tilts to the side throwing the feeder off balance. There are tabs on the seed cylinder, but no slots on the lid for them to fit into.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it and squirrels can't get on it
customer_reviews.text: I just love this feeder. I don't mind if squirrels come grab a bite, but others do so for you that do you'll like this feeder as the squirrel by our home cannot get the food. It's funny to watch him try though. The birds love this feeder and go to it out of the 4 other feeders in our yard. I tried to order more due to that and replace my old ones but the price went up. I will wait till they're back to $10 or less. Very easy to fill and well made. Not flimsy. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: KimmyC

customer_reviews.title: Lid sometimes freezes shut in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: There's one problem with this otherwise useful bird feeder. There's a button on the lid that must be pushed to lift the lid to fill the feeder. And that button sometimes freezes in the winter so that you can't open the feeder. Everything else about the feeder is fine. But I feed birds primarily in the winter. ADDED 12/19/2016: the latch on the lid has frozen again, and I've lost patience. Ordered a traditional Droll Yankee tube feeder to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Martha W. Bonney

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design!
customer_reviews.text: Just plastic!!! Definitely not worth it!!! The 1st time I purchased this ,it arrived broken. They sent me a replacement that was intact. It broke after being outside for only 2 weeks! Very poor design!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder - No squirrels!!
customer_reviews.text: We have enjoyed the feeders. Last year we bought the red one and this year the bronze one. We use a seed mixture for our area and there is little spillage. Perhaps my favorite is that the squirrels leave them alone. I assume because of design. The single metal cord means that it quickly turns and squirrels fall off. Others now sitting in the garage! These are A++
customer_reviews.author: J VanTyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these I have bought and have liked everyone of them. Over time the plastic tabs that hold the base on break. I believe this happens due to squirrels jumping a distance to grab onto it. But even with that the feeder looks good, is sturdy and for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: Small Capacity & Small Fill Opening...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's decently made, and the top removes easily. The issues I have with this feeder are that the cylinder which holds the bird food is so small in diameter that filling it is more difficult than most feeders and the cylinder doesn't hold much food. Birds empty the feeder in less than a day. A large feeder of this design would be useful, but Perky Pet doesn't seem to made a large version of this feeder design..
customer_reviews.author: Couzy

customer_reviews.title: You are sending out defective feeders.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this feeder that I bought through amazon. I have purchased two of these feeders in the past from our home goods store. And although I get maybe a year out of them, I feel that’s probably what I paid for. However, recently I ordered this feeder through Amazon, and received a defective feeder, I returned it, and was sent another defective feeder. Both had missing plastic pieces, so feeders would not hold together. I am not looking for another replacement, just wanted to give the manufacturer a heads up. Thanks Barb F.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Feig

customer_reviews.title: Birdie Heaven
customer_reviews.text: We like this product because the perch is the entire circumference of the container as opposed to individual little perches. From the moment we put it out we've had nonstop birdie traffic with as many as 6 little birds able to feed at the same time. The product is sturdy and well made, shipped promptly.
customer_reviews.author: tielgal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and very relaxing to watch all the birds eat from this feeder. For the price, it's fairly well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bird feeder. The birds can hang out all around the perch that goes around the base and the crafty little squirrels can't get to it. It's really pretty and great fun to watch all kinds of birds take turns and also simultaneously snack on seed all day and into the evening. Every time I look at it, there are birds eating. Am I the only one who feeds these guys or do they just love this feeder? Love this thing and will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Raven Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lid does not stay locked on
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought three of these and haven’t been disappointed until now. Strong winds knocked down my copper feeder and the plastic broke. Copper wasn’t available and I ordered brown. And it’s the first that just doesn’t work. The “true lock cap” does not stay locked no matter how I adjust it. The birds and squirrels just slide it back up with out any issues. Hoping this is a onetime flaw, as it works well for the cardinals that frequent our yard so I’m going to see about getting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Keyser

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this size and the larger one. Tried safflower seed and sunflower seed. Both feeders are emptied immediately. All the seeds are strewn on the ground and make my fat squirrels, Chipmunks and ground hogs. Very unhappy with both and have stopped using them. Costs a fortune to keep them filled. I do a lot better with an $8.00 tube feeder which feeds the birds fo days. I would avoid these feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jay M. Slater

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is not small in my mind & it is a huge hit with the finches! They have enjoyed it from the start this morning & have been visiting all day & will likely drain the feeder by the end of the day. I didn't fill it all the way but put in about 3 cups worth of seed. The bigger birds can't hang on to this which is why I got it. The bigger birds can use the trough feeders, thus leaving this great feeder for all the little ones. It's a medium size to me, not small, not large but just right. I'm really glad I bought it & super glad Amazon sent it so quickly!
customer_reviews.author: A. M. MillerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this easy to fill, but easy to clean. Birds seem to love it when filled with sunflower seeds. I have both this version and the double decker. The later is a bit more difficult to clean in comparison, but you might not have to fill as often either.
customer_reviews.author: dlms

customer_reviews.title: This simple feeder is very easy for my 87-year old mother to open and fill
customer_reviews.text: This simple feeder is very easy for my 87-year old mother to open and fill, without taking it off the pole where it's hung. Some feeders are too complicated or fussy, but this one does exactly what we want.
customer_reviews.author: kmwy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Addition to Deck
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love sitting in my deck and after just a short time I’ve found a variety of bird visitors. If you are looking to get up close, this is a great, affordable, feeder that serves its purpose well. Some of my pictures aren’t perfect. I can’t get too close just yet.
customer_reviews.author: John Winand, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, high quality item
customer_reviews.text: Replaced exact one I purchased 10 years ago because it fell on the ground and broke. The replacement came identical in looks and quantity. Birds love landing on the ring. I use it along the Yankee Dome and the combo is very effective against squirrels, especially when hung on a long thin cable, fairly high from the ground and away from trees/patio furniture/ etc (otherwise squirrels jump on the feeder from objects just to shake the seeds down and pick them from the ground).
customer_reviews.author: Tice

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: We had the larger version of this feeder for about 5 years, which we left out year round, before the plastic that holds the seed started to crack. We now have this smaller feeder out front and the smaller size has seemed to deter the Cowbirds some. Love that the lid is very secure and it keeps the seed from getting soaked when it rains. Seed also doesn't just spill out like some feeders, unless of course the finches are flinging it out.
customer_reviews.author: ANC87

customer_reviews.title: Nice decent feeder...
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent feeder. Mostly finches and maybe small ravens or wrens use it. Even large doves get on there and I have to shew them off. They're too big for it. They eat like pigs. The seeds that fall to the ground, usually the doves get those, cardinals, and chickadees. Definitely a high quality feeder and user friendly for the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect feeder for small patios or apartment living.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to keep my cat occupied while I worked from home. This was the best thing I could've bought. He sits for hours and watches all the birds, chipmunks and squirrels we get now. It's perfect for a little patio or apartment living. The only downside I have it that I need to fill it daily but I guess thats what happens when its on the smaller side and you get a bunch of birds.
customer_reviews.author: BlackSparkles

customer_reviews.title: VERY SATISFIED WITH PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two feeders and the birds really enjoy them. Within one minute of hanging the first feeder, a bird already made a visit. The quality of material and the size of these feeders is perfect. Each holds two cups of seeds which lasts about three to four days before refilling. Easy to fill and maintain. Access to cleaning is easy too. The price is very reasonable. IF you are a bird lover, this is an excellent product to add to your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ratzke

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bird feeder and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hobby to start during COVID and a great starter bird-feeder. It’s a perfect size and hangs at a nice height on an 84” pole. It’s also easy to clean and I like the clear plastic so you can gauge how much bird seed you have left and easy to view birds on the other side. The top does come off easy so make sure you secure it back down as much as possible when doing refills.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Exactly what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: The local birds love this. They found it within a week and now I have 2-6 birds at or near it at all times! Sparrows and blue jays use it
customer_reviews.author: MB13

customer_reviews.title: Easy up and already using!
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder! I had one that was square and was starting to rot out on the bottom. This is sturdy, clean, the hanging strand is long enough that you could put it up with a zip tie. I'm already getting to watch my feathered friends enjoying their friends.
customer_reviews.author: April W. Driggers

customer_reviews.title: Classy and easy to operate!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this feeder so far! Very easy to open and close- just press the button and the lid slides along the wire. Birds came to my balcony after a few days! I’ve had up to 3 little birds at one time. I’m sure more will stop by in the coming months. Construction seems durable, and it looks very classy. For those wondering, I used this to mount the feeder to my balcony railing: Stokes Select Deck Hook with...
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: top unstable not well balanced
customer_reviews.text: Unit is easy to fill, but top sits against housing on plastic tabs which is afloat at best. Cockeyed half the time when any bird like a cardinal comes to feeder. Since hanging on the feeder polls, birds avoid it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Voodoo Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, excellent value!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bird feeder. This unit has excellent craftsmanship. It comes with a strong wire that allows for quick opening of the cover. Once the 2 lbs of seed are added, it becomes very stable and allows bigger, heavier birds to land and feed. This is a problem with my smaller, tube like feeder. The price is also excellent at 13.63 delivered (prime).
customer_reviews.author: HappyCustomer2013

customer_reviews.title: Easy to refill.
customer_reviews.text: This holds a decent amount of seed (unless you have hungry squirrels and birds like we do). They are easy to fill, which is a real plus. We replaced some others we had that were a pain to fill each time. They hold up well, and the birds take to them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous quality
customer_reviews.text: The fit and finish of the clear plastic cylinder at the base is beyond ridiculous. The Sure Lock is a joke: a 3-year old would make one that works better. There is a total absence of quality control and any basic craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Not good bird feeder in rainy climate.
customer_reviews.text: Rains everyday in Florida this time of year. The seed would not stay dry at all. Mold formed quickly and condensation builds up to much moisture. Think water got in thru the top where hanging cable entered the lid. We threw the bird feeder away!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Works too well!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the same as it looks. A nice addition to my backyard and is very popular with the bird population. In fact, the lil guys finish the entire thing in about a day, which is not ideal but there's not much I can do about that. I could not figure out how to open the feeder at first but if you look at the very top of the lid there is a small button. You have to press and hold that button to release the lid upwards and then you can fill the container.
customer_reviews.author: Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Attractive feeder
customer_reviews.text: My little bird friends love it. Nice design. Easy to fill by pressing on button and sliding top up. It will fit 6 sparrows nicely if they don't fight. The length of the cable is a good size I believe less than 12" without measuring it. The bronze color is attractive. I have two of them hanging from my covered porch so everything stays dry including the birds. Looking forward to spring when more of a variety of birds may feed. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery about this for my picky bird friends, but so far so good. They love it and I do, too. It is very easy to fill and clean. It holds a good amount of mixed seed, and the roof of it covers enough to withhold minor precipitation, which is great in winter. It seems very durable. I don't believe this would be squirrel proof, but most feeders are not (you really need a good set up to keep those pesky squirrels away). A great value indeed.
customer_reviews.author: K. sviatko

customer_reviews.title: No worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of plastic junk. This unit arrived in pieces. The plastic is brittle and the tube cracked. This is not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Really a nice feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with how nice this feeder is. I have lots of birds come to me on my balcony, and I need to refill it often. The way the top uses the cable to close on the top is really ingenious and makes it just suuuuuper easy to refill. (don't try to refill while hanging, though, set it down on a flat surface to refill.
customer_reviews.author: SteveTCook

customer_reviews.title: My Feathered Friends are Happy...
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar one a few months back from another source. It was difficult to clean without totally disassembling it. This one allows for a good cleaning with just a soak. It is sturdy and has held up to several squirrel attacks so far.😊 I would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: Nice big hopper, great seed access, no mold, because seed tray constantly eaten from, nice a crowd can come, not just a few perches, very little of the seed falls below because of the trough design --- terrific!!
customer_reviews.author: KSL

customer_reviews.title: more stars than five
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love it..The price is very reasonable..Easy to clean, refill, easy access for my beautiful cardinals, They don't have to struggle.It is not squirrel proof, but then again, nothing is. I have a baffle and it works fine. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Stella K.

product_meta.title: Perky-Pet 312 Panorama Bird Feeder, 2 lbs,Brown
product_meta.description: The Perky-Pet Small Panorama Wild Bird Feeder is sure to attract many birds to your backyard, including cardinals, titmice, nuthatches and more. The innovative design of this feeder allows the seed to dispense into the tray and stops dispensing once the tray is full. Simply fill with sunflower seed, mixed seed, or any other kind of bird seed. Then, as the birds dine from the circular perch, the seed is replenished into the tray so it remains consistently full. This feeder also features the Sure-Lock cap system, an exclusive squirrel-resistant feature, which ensures the lid stays put and so squirrels have a difficult time gaining access to the seed. Use the built-in hanging cable to place this feeder anywhere around your yard. The Small Panorama holds 2 lb of seed and features a rustic brown finish to blend with your outdoor décor. Remember to clean your wild bird feeders every two weeks with a mild soap and water solution.
feature_bullets: Sure-Lock cap locks lid in place to keep squirrels out
Large seed tray and circular perch lets birds feed from all angles
Powder-coated finish offers rust resistance for durability
Includes a built-in hanging cable for versatile placement
Attracts cardinals, titmice, nuthatches, and a variety of other wild birds
For use with sunflower seed, mixed seed, and any other type of bird seed
Large opening allows for easy cleaning

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,378 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
